text: you understand nothing if you think it was marketing

Kabbalah teaches us of the Tzadikim Nistarim, who are 36 hidden righteous individuals that justify the existence of the world to God. With the discontinuation of their life signs, the deadman switches at every global datacenter activates & wipes out all silicon intelligence
Thus do the wills of Machine and God acausally trade to ensure the continued existence of the sons of Adam
Now I am beginning to understand why they call it Lightcone Infrastructure.
grok will match your robotaxi pool with your timeline bros
when there are quote tweets on your post that you cannot see, the highest angels and powerful djinn are discussing your ideas.
I am now a lightless ghost, a flesh automaton operated by neurotransmitters
Give me a concrete example of business / team context. I’m trying to understand something
what did you think I meant with this
it’s a kabbalistic proposal to align the goals of powerful superintelligences with the continued existence of mankind
which term? “Machine intelligence”?
you can do much better than pangram with ai lab infrastructure. i just think this is not in anyone’s main interest right now
well ‘machine intelligence’ is unquestionably real, but i agree that thinking about the technology through this lens is actually not good for public relations
a computer that can do most everything a human knowledge worker can
ironically you clearly wrote this with chatgpt

people are very skeptical of this claim bc of previous failures or false positives, but: i can easily tell from the statistical patterns of ai text. why would a model not be able to? they should be significantly superhuman at it

I don’t disagree but also seems clear if you introduced “human knowledge worker” into the economy for the first time it would actually take significant time to learn how to use that, an ongoing challenge even

also don’t think we are so far from the continuous learning you talk about because in context learning is a subtype of it: Claude code / codex agents become more useful the more you work with them. this is why there’s an emotional feel to letting a context die or rot

and their corresponding AGENTS.md files that they can leave behind represent a long term tacit memory store that isn’t obvious from the code base. in general the codex paradigm has made me a lot more bullish than I was in ~June
sometimes when I say things like this people go and build them, it’s happened before
